title: What is the answer of a-b(c+d) =? - Quora

response.answer_text: y=a-b(c+d) for “arbitrary” values of a, b, c, and d among the real numbers R PREMISES y=a-b(c+d) ASSUMPTIONS Let a, b, c, and d=any “arbitrary” values of real numbers R CALCULATIONS y=a-b(c+d), given “arbitrary” values of R y= a-b(c+d) EXAMPLE(S) If y=a-b(c+d), then the equations (1) y=a-b(c+d), where a=5, b=4, c=3, and d=2 y=5–4(3+2) y=5–4(5) y=5–20 and y=-15 (2) y=a-b(c+d), where a=7, b=5, c=3, and d=1 y=7–5(3+1) y=7–5(4) y=7–20 and y=-13 establish the answers to the value of a-b(c+d) in the set of real numbers R C.H.
Given : a- b(c+d) Apply left distributive property X(Y+Z) =XY+XZ a- b(c+d)= a-bc+bd
